comments.content:
I think there are two fonts here. The all-caps lettering looks like Zapf's Aldus, which is similar to Palatino, but without the serif on the arm of the F.   
   
The other font looks a bit like Palatino in the half serifs on the h and n. The other letters are quite different from Palatino, or any other Zapf fonts I looked at. The s is particularly odd with the missing lower serif.   
   
I am still looking into this one.

The similarities with Palatino are so strong that it seems somebody has borrowed the original font and has \_fine tuned\_ (?) it.   
   
Not so evident to consider it as an hybrid face, I think.

It's rather disturbing to see something that looks so much like Palatino, but with that incongruous 't' and 'a' (and other less obvious changes).   
   
There's something immoral about that comma.
